lod.title: Distant Horizons
lod.config.title: Distant Horizons config
lod.config.optionsButton.@tooltip: Show the config button to the left of the fov button
lod.config.client.graphics.quality.drawR:
The maximum detail fake chunks are rendered at.

§6Fastest:§r Chunk
§6Fanciest:§r Block
lod.config.client.graphics.quality.lodCh: The mod's render distance, measured in chunks.
lod.config.client.graphics.quality.verti:
How well fake chunks represent overhangs, caves, cliffsides, etc.

Higher options will increase memory and GPU usage.
lod.config.client.graphics.quality.horiz:
How quickly fake chunks drop off in quality.

Larger numbers will improve how distant terrain looks
but will increase memory and GPU usage.

How far apart drops in quality are.

Higher settings will increase the distance between drops
but will increase memory and GPU usage.
lod.config.client.graphics.quality.dropo:
How detail dropoff is calculated.

Higher settings will make the drop-off less noticeable
but will increase how often the geometry has to be rebuilt,
increasing CPU usage and the chance of stuttering.
lod.config.client.graphics.fogQuality.fo: The distance(s) Fog will be rendered on fake chunks.
When fog will be rendered on fake chunks.
The color of the fog on fake chunks.
lod.config.client.graphics.fogQuality.di:
§6True:§r disables Minecraft's fog on vanilla chunks.
§6False:§r Minecraft renders fog like normal.

May cause issues with other mods that edit fog.
Disable if vanilla chunks are completely covered in fog.
lod.config.client.graphics.advancedGraph:
How should the LODs be rendered?
NOTE: Currently only CUBIC is implemented!

§6False:§r fake chunks behind the player's camera aren't rendered, improving performance.
§6True:§r fake chunks are always rendered.

Leave False unless you see fake chunks disappearing at the edge of your vision.

§6False:§r fake chunks will drop off in quality the farther from the player they are, improving performance.
§6True:§r all fake chunks will be rendered at the highest available detail level.

Enabling this will drastically increase memory and GPU usage.

Determines how often fake chunks will be rendered on top of regular chunks.

§6Dynamic:§r attempts to pick the best option based on vanilla render distance and dimension.
§6Always:§r prevents holes in the world, but may look odd for transparent blocks or in caves.
§6Border:§r renders fake chunks on the border of the vanilla render distance, preventing gaps when the player isn't moving.
§6Never:§r fake chunks will never overlap the vanilla render distance, but there may be holes in the world.

Will prevent some overdraw issues,
but may cause nearby fake chunks to render incorrectly, especially when near fancy leaves.
Less noticeable with a longer vanilla render distance.
The distance where the back side of fake chunks aren't rendered to improve performance.
lod.config.client.worldGenerator.generat: The priority for chunks being generated around the player.
lod.config.client.worldGenerator.distanc:
How complicated the generation should be when generating fake chunks outside the vanilla render distance.

§6§6Fastest:§r Biome only
§6Best Quality:§r Features (suggested)
§6Best compatability:§r Full (Very slow, don't use unless the fake chunks generate incorrectly.)
lod.config.client.worldGenerator.allowUn:
Some features may not be thread safe.
Could cause instability and crashes
lod.config.client.worldGenerator.blocksT: Defines the types of blocks to ignore when generating fake chunks.
lod.config.client.worldGenerator.enableD:
§6True:§r in single player fake chunks will be generated outside the vanilla render distance.
Note: this can use a large amount of CPU.

§6False:§r fake chunks will only generate within the vanilla render distance.
lod.config.client.worldGenerator.lightGe:
§6Fancy:§r use Minecraft's lighting engine, gives accurate lighting.
§6Fast:§r estimate block lighting, shadows won't be as smooth.

If the fake chunks appear black, set this to §6Fast:§r.
lod.config.client.advanced.threading.num:
The number of threads used to generate fake chunks
outside the normal render distance.
If you experience stuttering when generating fake chunks: decrease this number.
If you want to increase LOD generation speed: increase this number.

Can only be between 1 and your CPU's processor count.

The number of threads used when building vertex buffers
(The things sent to your GPU to draw the fake chunks).
Can only be between 1 and your CPU's processor count.
lod.config.client.advanced.buffers.gpuUp:
The method for uploading geometry to the GPU.

If you experience stuttering while your CPU and GPU usage is low, try changing this setting.
Note: if you are in a world you may have to leaving and rejoin to see the full effect.

How long should a buffer wait per Megabyte of data uploaded?
May be increased if there is frame stuttering.
lod.config.client.advanced.buffers.rebui: How frequently should vertex buffers (geometry) be rebuilt and sent to the GPU?
lod.config.client.advanced.debugging.dra:
§6True:§r fake chunks will be rendered.
§6False:§r fake chunks will not be rendered, however they will still be generated and saved to file.
lod.config.client.advanced.debugging.ena: §6True:§r debug keybindings can be used to change the Debug mode in game.
